article_text: PEKING (AP) — Authorities arrested a student accused of giving intelligence to an American reporter, the official news media said Sunday, in what appeared to be the first move against the press in China’s anti-Westernization campaign. The official Xinhua News Agency said in a two-paragraph report that Lin Jie, a student of Tianjin University, was arrested for “his secret collusion with and providing intelligence to’’ Lawrence MacDonald, reporter for the French news agency Agence France-Presse. The report said conclusive evidence was obtained by the Tianjin office of the State Security Bureau, a secretive organization responsible for China’s external security.
